|url=https://www.nba.com/news/10-biggest-nba-draft-steals-last-10-years |website=[[NBA.com]]}}</ref> A six-time [[NBA All-Star]], Jokić has been named to the [[All-NBA Team]] on six occasions (including four first-team selections), and won the [[NBA Most Valuable Player Award]] for the [[2020–21 NBA season|2020–21]], [[2021–22 NBA season|2021–22]], and [[2023–24 NBA season|2023–24]] seasons. He represents the [[Serbia men's national basketball team|Serbian national team]], with which he won a silver medal at the [[Basketball at the 2016 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2016 Summer Olympics]], and a bronze medal at the [[Basketball at the 2024 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2024 Summer Olympics]].

Jokić was selected by the Nuggets in the second round of the [[2014 NBA draft]]. He was voted to the [[NBA All-Rookie First Team]] in [[2015–16 NBA season|2016]]. In the [[2018–19 NBA season]], while leading the Nuggets to the [[2019 NBA playoffs|Western Conference Semifinals]], Jokić received his first All-Star and All-NBA First Team selections. The following season, he once again received All-Star and All-NBA honors, while leading his team to the [[2020 NBA playoffs|Western Conference Finals]]. In the [[2022–23 NBA season]], Jokić was awarded [[NBA Finals Most Valuable Player Award|NBA Finals MVP]] after leading the Nuggets to their first-ever [[2023 NBA Finals|NBA championship]]. He ranks among the top three on the all-time list of the NBA players with the most [[triple-doubles]] ([[List of National Basketball Association career triple-double leaders|regular season]] and [[List of National Basketball Association career playoff triple-double leaders|playoffs]]), where Jokić is the leading international player and center,<ref>{{Cite web |last=Askounis |first=John |date=December 21, 2019 |title=Nikola Jokic ties Bob Cousy for 10th place in all-time triple-double list |url=https://www.eurohoops.net/en/nba-news/989153/nikola-jokic-ties-bob-cousy-for-10th-place-in-all-time-triple-double-list/ |access-date=December 24, 2019 |website=eurohoops.net |archive-date=October 17, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221017075500/https://www.eurohoops.net/en/nba-news/989153/nikola-jokic-ties-bob-cousy-for-10th-place-in-all-time-triple-double-list/ |url-status=live }}</ref> and he holds the record for the fastest triple-double (achieved in 14 minutes and 33 seconds).<ref name="tdrecord3">{{Cite web |last=Redford |first=Patrick |date=February 16, 2018 |title=Well That Was A Spectacular, Historic Game From Nikola Jokic |url=https://deadspin.com/well-that-was-a-spectacular-historic-game-from-nikola-1823059918 |access-date=January 28, 2023 |website=Deadspin |language=en |archive-date=October 20, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221020030412/https://deadspin.com/well-that-was-a-spectacular-historic-game-from-nikola-1823059918 |url-status=live }}</ref>

==Early life==
Jokić was born in the city of [[Sombor]] in the [[Vojvodina|northern part]] of [[Serbia]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |last=Calle |first=Franklyn |date=March 26, 2017 |title=Nikola Jokic on Growing Up in Serbia, Racing Horses as a Kid and Adjusting to NBA Life in America |url=https://www.slamonline.com/nba/nikola-jokic-nuggets-interview/ |access-date=March 26, 2021 |website=[[Slam (magazine)|SLAM]] |language=en |archive-date=December 21, 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161221132817/https://www.slamonline.com/nba/nikola-jokic-nuggets-interview/ |url-status=live }}</ref> He grew up in a cramped two-bedroom apartment that housed him, his two brothers, parents, and grandmother.<ref name=":4">{{Cite web |last=Sepkowitz |first=Leo |date=February 15, 2017 |title=Born of a New Eastern Europe, Nikola Jokic Leads a Generation to NBA Stardom |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2692809-born-of-a-new-eastern-europe-nikola-jokic-leads-a-generation-to-nba-stardom |access-date=March 26, 2021 |website=[[Bleacher Report]] |language=en |archive-date=February 15, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170215170407/https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2692809-born-of-a-new-eastern-europe-nikola-jokic-leads-a-generation-to-nba-stardom |url-status=live }}</ref> He attended primary school "Dositej Obradović."<ref>{{Cite web |title=U tem Somboru... Nikola Jokić dobio mural |url=https://www.rts.rs/lat/magazin/svet-poznatih/3419266/u-tem-somboru-nikola-jokic-dobio-mural.html |access-date=2024-12-20 |website=РТС |language=sr}}</ref> His father was an agricultural engineer.<ref>{{Cite web|date=August 28, 2019|title=Nikola Jokic: Serbia's beloved big man of basketball|url=https://www.france24.com/en/20190828-nikola-jokic-serbia-s-beloved-big-man-of-basketball|access-date=March 26, 2021|website=[[France 24]]|language=en|archive-date=May 7, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230507022532/https://www.france24.com/en/20190828-nikola-jokic-serbia-s-beloved-big-man-of-basketball|url-status=live}}</ref> Jokić developed a love of basketball early in his life playing with his two older brothers, Strahinja and Nemanja, who were a decade older.<ref name=":4" /> Both brothers played basketball in Serbia with Nemanja later playing [[college basketball]] for [[Detroit Mercy Titans men's basketball|Detroit Mercy]] and [[LIU Post Pioneers|C.W. Post]] and for Scranton/Wilkes-Barre Steamers in the [[Premier Basketball League]].<ref name="jenkins1">{{Cite magazine |last=Jenkins |first=Lee |date=February 8, 2017 |title=The Joker: Nikola Jokic Gets Serious In Denver |url=https://www.si.com/nba/2017/02/08/nikola-jokic-denver-nuggets-the-joker-serbia-darko-milicic |access-date=February 12, 2017 |magazine=[[Sports Illustrated]] |archive-date=November 12, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201112023201/https://www.si.com/nba/2017/02/08/nikola-jokic-denver-nuggets-the-joker-serbia-darko-milicic |url-status=live }}</ref> The brothers are friends with former NBA player [[Darko Miličić]].<ref name="jenkins1" /> Jokić also loved [[harness racing]] as a child and competed as an amateur, a passion he still holds today.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1">{{Cite web |last=Beck |first=Howard |date=November 1, 2017 |title=The Way of the Joker |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2741818-the-way-of-the-joker-nikola-jokic |access-date=March 26, 2021 |website=[[Bleacher Report]] |language=en |archive-date=November 1, 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171101175751/https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2741818-the-way-of-the-joker-nikola-jokic |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3cgoOdXI1B4 |title=Tropfy of Sombor city (Arena Sport TV - Official channel |website=[[YouTube]] |date=June 18, 2023 |access-date=June 19, 2023 |archive-date=June 19, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230619171120/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3cgoOdXI1B4 |url-status=live }}</ref>

==Professional career==
===Mega Basket (2012–2015)===
Jokić played youth basketball for [[KK Vojvodina Srbijagas|Vojvodina Srbijagas]],<ref>{{Cite web |title=Joker Continues Wild Journey With Value |date=June 24, 2021 |url=https://theleadsm.com/joker-continues-wild-journey-with-value/ |access-date=June 10, 2023 |archive-date=June 10, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230610212458/https://theleadsm.com/joker-continues-wild-journey-with-value/ |url-status=live }}</ref> drawing attention when he had achieved a [[Performance Index Rating|total index rating]] greater than 50 in two consecutive games.<ref name="bbcserbian">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/serbian/lat/srbija-57417927|title=Jokić, NBA liga i MVP: Da li je Somborac najbolji srpski košarkaš svih vremena|trans-title=Jokić, the NBA and the MVP: is the Somborian the best Serbian basketball player of all time|last1=Andrić|first1=Grujica|last2=Maričić|first2=Slobodan|date=June 9, 2021|language=sr|website=BBC News in Serbian|access-date=June 10, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230610200216/https://www.bbc.com/serbian/lat/srbija-57417927|archive-date=June 10, 2023|url-status=live}}</ref> In December 2012, Jokić signed a contract with [[KK Mega Basket|Mega Vizura]], although in the first season with the team he played mostly for their junior team in 2012–13.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Vecenie |first=Sam |title=Inside Nikola Jokic's path from Serbia to the Nuggets to NBA MVP. 'Just kind of lucky scouting' |url=https://theathletic.com/2635857/2021/06/08/inside-nikola-jokics-path-from-serbia-to-the-nuggets-to-nba-mvp-just-kind-of-lucky-scouting/ |date=June 9, 2021 |access-date=2023-06-13 |website=[[The Athletic]] |language=en |url-access=subscription |archive-date=June 13, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230613222236/https://theathletic.com/2635857/2021/06/08/inside-nikola-jokics-path-from-serbia-to-the-nuggets-to-nba-mvp-just-kind-of-lucky-scouting/ |url-status=live }}</ref> At the age of 17, Jokić appeared in five games of the [[Basketball League of Serbia|Serbian League]] and averaged 1.8 points and 2.0 rebounds in 10.2 minutes per game.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kls.rs/igrac_stat.php?igrac=311|title=Timovi: Mega Vizura - Jokić Nikola|access-date=June 11, 2023|website=[[Basketball League of Serbia]]|language=sr|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130609115838/http://www.kls.rs/igrac_stat.php?igrac=311|archive-date=June 9, 2013|url-status=dead}}</ref> In February 2013, he officially signed a four-year contract with the team.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bcmegabasket.net/en/2015/10/19/28-02-2013-nikola-jokic-potpisao-prvi-profesionalni-ugovor/|title=28. 02. 2013 Nikola Jokić signed first professional contract|date=October 19, 2015|access-date=June 11, 2023|website=[[KK Mega Basket]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230611180717/https://www.bcmegabasket.net/en/2015/10/19/28-02-2013-nikola-jokic-potpisao-prvi-profesionalni-ugovor/|archive-date=June 11, 2023|url-status=live}}</ref>

In the 2013–14 season, Jokić saw more minutes on the court for the senior team. Over 25 [[2013–14 ABA League|Adriatic League]] games, he averaged 11.4 points, 6.4 rebounds and 2.5 assists per game.<ref name="abaleague1">{{cite web|url=https://www.aba-liga.com/player/2283/13/1/nikola-jokic/|title=Individual Statistics - Season 2013/14|website=[[ABA League]]|access-date=June 10, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230323205844/https://www.aba-liga.com/player/2283/22/1/nikola-jokic/|archive-date=March 23, 2023|url-status=live}}</ref> Jokić also played 13 games with the team in the [[2013–14 Basketball League of Serbia|Serbian League]] and had similar production, averaging 10.9 points, 6.0 rebounds, and 3.3 assists per game.

====2014–15 season: ABA League MVP and rebounding title====
On June 26, 2014, Jokić was selected by the [[Denver Nuggets]] with the 41st overall pick in the [[2014 NBA draft]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Carbaugh|first1=Dane|title=Denver takes Nikola Jokić with the No. 41 pick in the 2014 NBA Draft|url=https://www.sbnation.com/nba/2014/6/26/5848212/nba-draft-results-2014-denver-nuggets-nikola-jokic|website=[[SB Nation]]|publisher=[[Vox Media]]|date=June 26, 2014|access-date=June 27, 2014|archive-date=May 21, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210521180751/https://www.sbnation.com/nba/2014/6/26/5848212/nba-draft-results-2014-denver-nuggets-nikola-jokic|url-status=live}}</ref> In the first game of the [[2014–15 ABA League|Adriatic League]], Jokić led his team to a 103–98 victory over [[KK MZT Skopje|MZT Skopje]], by scoring 27 points and grabbing 15 rebounds for a total index rating of 44.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jokić, Miljenović nadjačali MZT|url=http://www.b92.net/sport/kosarka/vesti.php?yyyy=2014&mm=10&dd=04&nav_id=907621|date=October 4, 2014|access-date=July 15, 2023|work=[[B92]]|language=sr|archive-date=October 7, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141007045235/http://www.b92.net/sport/kosarka/vesti.php?yyyy=2014&mm=10&dd=04&nav_id=907621|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Overtime win for Mega, Jokić with index 44! |url=http://www.abaliga.com/a7904/ABA_Contents/News/Overtime_win_for_Mega_Jokic_with_index_44_.html |date=October 4, 2014|access-date=July 15, 2023 |website=[[ABA League]] |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006074751/http://www.abaliga.com/a7904/ABA_Contents/News/Overtime_win_for_Mega_Jokic_with_index_44_.html |archive-date=October 6, 2014 }}</ref> On November 3, Jokić recorded 17 points, 12 rebounds and season-high eight assists for a total index rating of 40, in a 90–84 victory over [[KK Zadar|Zadar]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Mega Vizura won, Jokić dominated |url=http://www.abaliga.com/a8249/News/Mega_Vizura_won_Jokic_dominated.html |access-date=November 3, 2014 |work=[[ABA League]] |date=November 3, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141104001118/http://www.abaliga.com/a8249/News/Mega_Vizura_won_Jokic_dominated.html |archive-date=November 4, 2014 }}</ref> On February 7, 2015, he scored 27 points and grabbed 15 rebounds in a 88–77 loss to [[Szolnoki Olaj KK|Szolnoki Olaj]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Mega Leks at Szolnoki Olaj Full Statistics |url=http://www.abaliga.com/game/146/Szolnoki_Olaj-Mega_Leks |website=[[ABA League]] |access-date=March 24, 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150209100136/http://www.abaliga.com/game/146/Szolnoki_Olaj-Mega_Leks |archive-date=February 9, 2015 }}</ref> On March 21, Jokić scored a season-high 28 points and added 15 rebounds to help his team win 100–96 over [[KK Igokea|Igokea]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Mega Leks at Igokea Full Statistics |url=http://www.abaliga.com/game/180/Mega_Leks-Igokea |access-date=March 24, 2015 |work=[[ABA League]] |language=sr |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150324184454/http://www.abaliga.com/game/180/Mega_Leks-Igokea |archive-date=March 24, 2015 }}</ref> Although Mega Leks finished in 10th place in the Adriatic League, Jokić became one of the league's most valuable players.

On June 8, 2015, Jokić scored 23 points in a loss to [[KK Crvena Zvezda|Crvena Zvezda]] in the playoff semifinals of the [[2014–15 Basketball League of Serbia|Serbian League]].<ref>{{cite On October 26, 2024, Jokić scored 41 points and made a career-high seven 3-pointers in a 109–103 loss to the [[Los Angeles Clippers]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Harden, Powell help Clippers overcome Jokic's 41 points to beat Nuggets 109-104 |url=https://www.espn.com/nba/recap/_/gameId/401704653|website=ESPN.com|date=October 26, 2024|access-date=October 26, 2024}}</ref> In the next game, Jokić posted 40 points, 10 rebounds, four assists and two blocks in a 127–125 overtime win over the [[Toronto Raptors]]. He recorded back-to-back 40-point games for the first time in his career.<ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Linn |first1=Joey|title=Nikola Jokic Makes NBA History in Denver Nuggets vs. Toronto Raptors |url=https://www.si.com/nba/nuggets/news/nikola-jokic-makes-nba-history-in-denver-nuggets-vs-toronto-raptors-01jbb1rgbg50 |magazine=Sports Illustrated |date=October 28, 2024 |language=en-us |access-date=October 30, 2024}}</ref> On October 29, Jokić had a triple-double with 29 points, 18 rebounds and 16 assists in a 144–139 overtime win over the [[Brooklyn Nets]]. He became just the second player in NBA history to achieve this stat line and the first in 62 years. The only player previously to reach those totals in a game was [[Oscar Robertson]], who did it twice in 1962. Jokić also became the 1st player with multiple triple-doubles and multiple 40-point games within his first 4 games of a season in NBA history.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Grez |first=Matias |date=2024-10-30 |title=Nikola Jokić becomes only second NBA player ever – and first in 62 years – to record historic milestone and more from Tuesday in the NBA |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2024/10/30/sport/nikola-jokic-history-nba-roundup-spt/index.html |access-date=2024-10-30 |website=CNN |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Kimble |first1=Kade|title=Nikola Jokic Makes NBA History in Denver Nuggets vs. Brooklyn Nets |url=https://www.si.com/nba/nuggets/news/nikola-jokic-makes-nba-history-in-denver-nuggets-vs-brooklyn-nets |magazine=Sports Illustrated |date=October 29, 2024 |language=en-us |access-date=October 30, 2024}}</ref> On November 6, Jokić logged a triple-double with 23 points, 20 rebounds, 16 assists, two steals and two blocks in a 124–122 win over the [[Oklahoma City Thunder]]. He joined [[Russell Westbrook]] (Apr. 2, 2019) as the 2nd player to record a 20/20/15 game since [[Wilt Chamberlain]] in 1968.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Helin |first1=Kurt |title=Jokic's triple-double, 29 from Westbrook, Watson's game-saving block help Nuggets hand Thunder first loss |url=https://www.nbcsports.com/nba/news/jokics-triple-double-29-from-westbrook-watsons-game-saving-block-help-nuggets-hand-thunder-first-loss |access-date=November 7, 2024 |work=NBC Sports |date=November 7, 2024 }}</ref> On November 8, Jokić posted 30 points, 11 rebounds and 14 assists on 11-of-13 shooting from the field in a 135–122 win over the [[Miami Heat]]. With 30 points, 11 rebounds, and 14 assists on 84% shooting, he joined Wilt Chamberlain as just the second player in NBA history to record that line on at least 80% from the field. This was Jokić's third career 30-point triple-double on at least 80% shooting. Only Chamberlain has more.<ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Linn |first1=Joey |title=Nikola Jokic Makes NBA History in Denver Nuggets vs. Miami Heat |url=https://www.si.com/nba/nuggets/news/nikola-jokic-makes-nba-history-in-denver-nuggets-vs-miami-heat-01jc7jjacwaf |magazine=Sports Illustrated |date=November 8, 2024 |language=en-us |access-date=November 10, 2024}}</ref> On November 10, Jokić had 37 points, 18 rebounds, 15 assists and three steals for his fourth straight triple-double in a 122–120 win over the [[Dallas Mavericks]]. He recorded a stat line in this game that no other player in NBA history has reached. Jokić also became the first player in NBA history to compile the following numbers after the first 10 games of a season: 297 points, 137 rebounds and 117 assists.<ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Linn |first1=Joey |title=Nikola Jokic Makes NBA History in Nuggets-Mavericks |url=https://www.si.com/nba/nuggets/news/nikola-jokic-makes-nba-history-in-denver-nuggets-vs-okc-thunder-01jc4c9r1dfg |magazine=Sports Illustrated |date=November 10, 2024 |language=en-us |access-date=November 10, 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Kia MVP Ladder: Nikola Jokić's hot start leads to jump to No. 1 |url=https://www.nba.com/news/kia-mvp-ladder-nov-15-2024-edition|website=NBA.com|date=November 15, 2024|access-date=November 15, 2024}}</ref>

On December 5, he posted his 139th career triple-double with 27 points, 20 rebounds, and 11 assists in a 126–114 loss to the [[Cleveland Cavaliers]]. He also passed [[Magic Johnson]] for third place in the NBA's [[List of NBA career triple-double leaders|all time triple-doubles list]].<ref>{{Cite web|last=Botkin|first=Brad|url=https://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/nikola-jokic-passes-magic-johnson-on-career-triple-doubles-list-but-those-arent-his-most-impressive-numbers/|title=Nikola Jokic passes Magic Johnson on career triple-doubles list, but those aren't his most impressive numbers|publisher=[[CBS Sports]]|date=December 6, 2024|access-date=December 6, 2024}}</ref> On December 8, Jokić scored a career-high 56 points in a loss against the Washington Wizards. It was just the third time in NBA history that a player had tallied 56 points, 16 rebounds, and eight assists in a game. The other two instances were Elgin Baylor (1959) and Luka Doncic (2022). He also became the first player in NBA history to put up at least 55 points, 15 rebounds, five assists, and three three-pointers made in a game.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-12-07 |title=Nikola Jokic Makes NBA History in Nuggets-Wizards |url=https://www.yardbarker.com/nba/articles/nikola_jokic_makes_nba_history_in_nuggets_wizards/s1_17250_41369159 |access-date=2024-12-08 |website=Yardbarker |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://clutchpoints.com/nikola-jokic-career-high-performance-spoiled-with-nuggets-loss-to-wizards|title=Nikola Jokic career-high performance spoiled with Nuggets' loss to Wizards|website=ClutchPoints|last=Strand|first=Rachel|date=December 8, 2024|access-date=December 8, 2024}}</ref> The next day, Jokić logged 48 points, 14 rebounds, eight assists and three steals in a 141–111 win over the [[Atlanta Hawks]]. One of these instances was by Jokić himself in 2022, two were by his Nuggets' teammate Russell Westbrook (2015, 2017) and the other was [[Larry Bird]] in 1992. He also became only the third player in NBA history to record back-to-back games with at least 45 points, 10 rebounds, and five assists. The first two were Elgin Baylor in 1961 and Wilt Chamberlain in 1963.<ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Linn |first1=Joey |title=Nikola Jokic Makes NBA History in Nuggets vs Hawks |url=https://www.si.com/nba/nuggets/news/nikola-jokic-makes-nba-history-in-nuggets-vs-hawks-01jemg7xt564 |magazine=Sports Illustrated |date=December 8, 2024 |language=en-us |access-date=December 8, 2024}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-12-08 |title=
